com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class GetResourcePrivilegesRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.GetResourcePrivilegesRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class GetResourcePrivilegesRequest
extends SiperianRequest
    Get privilege information about multiple resources. The privileges can either be for a user or a role. The user for which the privileges are returned can be different from the user whose login credentials are provided in the request. Similarly the login user need not be associated with the role for which the privileges are returned. The resources specified in the request can be Siperian resources or custom resources but cannot be resource groups. Resource UIDs specified in the request must match the UIDs stored in the SIPERIAN_OBJECT_UID column in the C_REPOS_SAM_RESOURCE table.

    User making this request must have read privilege to the SiperianObjectType.SAM_RESOURCE_METADATA "METADATA" resource.

    Required Parameters:
    • setResourceUids(Set)
    Usage Example:

    The following example gets privileges for the current user for 4 resources. 

    
 GetResourcePrivilegesRequest request = new GetResourcePrivilegesRequest();
 Set uids = new HashSet();
 uids.add(SiperianObjectType.PACKAGE.makeUid("ADDR_FK_ON_ID_PKG"));
 uids.add(SiperianObjectType.SAM_RESOURCE_METADATA.makeUid("METADATA"));
 uids.add(SiperianObjectType.COLUMN.makeUid("C_ADDR_ADDR_TYPE_REL", "ROWID_OBJ_ADDR"));
 uids.add(SiperianObjectType.COLUMN.makeUid("C_ADDR_FK_ON_ID", "ADDRESS"));
 request.setResourceUids(uids);
 GetResourcePrivilegesResponse response = sipClient.process(request);
    See Also:
    GetResourcePrivilegesResponse, Serialized Form

    API Pair: GetResourcePrivilegesResponse

    API Group: Security

      • getTransactionAttributeType

        public TransactionAttributeType getTransactionAttributeType()
        Description copied from class: SiperianRequest
        Each concrete request class will have a transaction type that it uses.

        This only matters when EjbSiperianClient is used, where your application code can process multiple requests in one transaction (and use rollback, and so on) by running within an EJB context or by creating a UserTransaction.

        If the subclass does not override this method, the default here is TransactionAttributeType.REQUIRED

        Overrides:
        getTransactionAttributeType in class SiperianRequest
        Returns:
        TransactionAttributeType.SUPPORTS

      • validate

        Throws exception if user and role are both set, or if no resourceUids are given.
